title_full: SAP01-BP01 Understand your SAP environment on AWS
title: Understand your SAP environment on AWS
description: Understanding your SAP environment on AWS is essential for effective operations. Document your SAP landscape including system IDs (SIDs), instance numbers, database types, and dependencies between systems. Maintain up-to-date architecture diagrams and configuration documentation.

title_full: SAP01-BP02 Document SAP system architecture and dependencies
title: Document SAP system architecture and dependencies
description: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of your SAP system architecture including network topology, storage configuration, and integration points. Document dependencies between SAP systems and external interfaces to support troubleshooting and disaster recovery planning.

title_full: SAP02-BP01 Implement change management processes for SAP workloads
title: Implement change management processes for SAP workloads
description: Establish formal change management processes for SAP workloads that align with SAP best practices and your organizational standards. Include change advisory board reviews for significant changes and maintain change logs for audit purposes.

title_full: SAP02-BP02 Use SAP transport management system effectively
title: Use SAP transport management system effectively
description: Leverage SAP Transport Management System (TMS) to manage changes across your SAP landscape. Configure transport routes that reflect your development, quality assurance, and production environment topology. Implement import queues and approval workflows.

title_full: SAP02-BP03 Automate infrastructure changes using Infrastructure as Code
title: Automate infrastructure changes using Infrastructure as Code
description: Use Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as AWS CloudFormation, AWS CDK, or Terraform to automate infrastructure changes for SAP workloads. Version control your infrastructure definitions and implement review processes for infrastructure changes.

title_full: SAP03-BP01 Design your SAP workload to allow understanding and reacting to its state
title: Design your SAP workload to allow understanding and reacting to its state
description: Design SAP workloads with comprehensive monitoring and observability capabilities. Implement monitoring for SAP application logs, database performance, operating system metrics, and AWS infrastructure. Use Amazon CloudWatch, AWS X-Ray, and SAP Solution Manager for end-to-end visibility.

title_full: SAP03-BP02 Implement SAP-specific monitoring using Amazon CloudWatch
title: Implement SAP-specific monitoring using Amazon CloudWatch
description: Configure Amazon CloudWatch to collect and monitor SAP-specific metrics including work process utilization, dialog response times, batch job performance, and ABAP dump occurrences. Create CloudWatch dashboards for SAP operations teams.

title_full: SAP03-BP03 Configure alerting and automated responses for SAP events
title: Configure alerting and automated responses for SAP events
description: Set up CloudWatch Alarms and Amazon EventBridge rules to detect and respond to SAP operational events. Configure notifications through Amazon SNS for critical alerts and implement automated remediation using AWS Lambda or AWS Systems Manager Automation.

title_full: SAP04-BP01 Perform regular workload reviews to optimize for resiliency, performance, agility, and cost
title: Perform regular workload reviews to optimize for resiliency, performance, agility, and cost
description: Conduct regular reviews of your SAP workloads using the AWS Well-Architected Framework and SAP Lens. Identify areas for improvement in resiliency, performance, operational efficiency, and cost optimization. Implement findings through prioritized remediation plans.

title_full: SAP04-BP02 Use AWS Trusted Advisor and AWS Compute Optimizer for SAP workloads
title: Use AWS Trusted Advisor and AWS Compute Optimizer for SAP workloads
description: Leverage AWS Trusted Advisor to identify optimization opportunities for security, fault tolerance, performance, and cost. Use AWS Compute Optimizer to receive recommendations for right-sizing EC2 instances running SAP workloads based on utilization metrics.

title_full: SAP05-BP01 Implement runbooks for common SAP operational tasks
title: Implement runbooks for common SAP operational tasks
description: Create and maintain runbooks for common SAP operational tasks such as system refreshes, backup and restore, kernel upgrades, and incident response. Use AWS Systems Manager Automation to implement runbooks as automated workflows where possible.

title_full: SAP05-BP02 Automate SAP system operations using AWS Systems Manager
title: Automate SAP system operations using AWS Systems Manager
description: Use AWS Systems Manager to automate routine SAP operations including patch management, inventory collection, and parameter configuration. Implement Systems Manager Automation documents for SAP-specific tasks such as start/stop sequences and health checks.

title_full: SAP05-BP03 Establish SAP basis administration practices on AWS
title: Establish SAP basis administration practices on AWS
description: Adapt SAP Basis administration practices for AWS infrastructure. Train operations teams on AWS-specific considerations for SAP including storage management with Amazon EBS, network configuration with Amazon VPC, and integration with AWS monitoring services.
